H0.text: In the Bible, how many psalms make up the Book of Psalms. 120

H1.text: In the Bible, how many psalms make up the Book of Psalms. 100

H2.text: In the Bible, how many psalms make up the Book of Psalms. 180

H3.text: In the Bible, how many psalms make up the Book of Psalms. 150

A4.text: In the Jewish and Western Christian traditions, there are 150 psalms, and several more in the Eastern Christian churches.

A5.text: The Septuagint, present in Eastern Orthodox churches, includes a Psalm 151; a Hebrew version of this was found in the Psalms Scroll of the Dead Sea Scrolls.

A6.text: Many psalms (116 of the 150) have individual superscriptions (titles)

A7.text: Some versions of the Peshitta (the Bible used in Syriac churches mainly in the Middle East) include Psalms 152â€“155

A8.text: However, that is not the case in the Eastern Orthodox and Syriac Orthodox canons, which have 151 and 155 psalms respectively.

A9.text: Psalms Chapter 150 text in Hebrew and English

A10.text: As well as the 150 Psalms, medieval psalters often included a calendar, a litany of saints, canticles from the Old and New Testaments, and other devotional texts.
